shortdesc.ph: Adjusts the volume of the custom external audio source when it is published in the channel.

p.codeblock: public abstract int adjustCustomAudioPublishVolume(int trackId, int volume);
virtual int adjustCustomAudioPublishVolume(track_id_t trackId, int volume) = 0;
public abstract int AdjustCustomAudioPublishVolume(uint trackId, int volume);
Future<void> adjustCustomAudioPublishVolume( {required int trackId, required int volume});

section.title: Details
section.note: Ensure you have called the method to create an external audio track before calling this method.
section.p: If you want to change the volume of the audio to be published, you need to call this method again.

plentry.pd: The audio track ID. Set this parameter to the custom audio track ID returned in .
The volume of the audio source. The value can range from 0 to 100. 0 means mute; 100 means the original volume.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown; and you need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly.
